I'm unable to determine the exact force required to break a wrist from this image alone. The amount of force needed to break a wrist depends on various factors including the specific bones involved, the angle and direction of the applied force, the age and health of the individual, and the grip strength.

Generally, wrist bones require a force in the range of several hundred newtons (N) to fracture, but this varies widely. If you are trying to calculate or apply a force in a robotic or mechanical system, you would need detailed biomechanical data and context-specific testing rather than just an image.

If you provide more detailed biomechanical parameters or data, I might be able to help estimate forces more accurately.
